decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of Elf creatures and buff them with cards like Timberwatch Elf and Nyxborn Hydra. The deck also includes a lot of card draw and mana ramp to ensure a consistent flow of threats and resources. The inclusion of creatures like Generous Ent and Avenging Hunter provide additional ways to support the aggro strategy, while Masked Vandal offers removal options. Wellwisher helps to sustain the deck against aggressive opponents.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to control the board by eliminating threats with cards like Snuff Out and Cast Down, while also utilizing counterspells like Counterspell and Force Spike to stop key spells from resolving. Card draw spells such as Brainstorm and Thought Scour help maintain card advantage, while cards like Lórien Revealed can both draw cards and provide additional utility. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Balustrade Spy combo to mill yourself and put the key pieces of your combo into the graveyard. This involves sacrificing the Balustrade Spy to return all the cards from your library to the battlefield, including creatures with abilities that trigger when they enter the battlefield (such as Sagu Wildling and Generous Ent). The deck also includes support cards like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way to help dig for your combo pieces, as well as additional creatures and ramp to maintain board presence and keep the combo going.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through a combination of removal spells and sacrificing creatures for value. By utilizing cards like Pestilence and Fanatical Offering, along with creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Troll of Khazad-dûm, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Nutrient Block and Lembas help provide additional resources to keep the engine running smoothly. The Golgari / Jund Garden archetype also allows for land synergy through cards like Khalni Garden and Golgari Rot Farm.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful Elves that can quickly build up board presence and deal out damage. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Elvish Mystic and Priest of Titania, this deck can ramp up quickly and play multiple threats in a single turn. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to refill the hand with more Elves, while cards like Timberwatch Elf and Nyxborn Hydra provide additional power to close out the game. Overall, this deck aims to flood the board and outpace the opponent with aggressive Elf creatures.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing artifacts and creatures to overwhelm your opponent. By combining efficient artifact creatures like Myr Enforcer and Gearseeker Serpent with card draw from Ichor Wellspring and Thoughtcast, you can quickly build a strong board presence. Utilize cards like Refurbished Familiar and Nihil Spellbomb to disrupt your opponent's strategy and finish them off with direct damage spells like Galvanic Blast. Additionally, cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Makeshift Munitions provide additional removal options to control the board in your favor.

This deck is focused on quickly playing low-cost aggressive creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a high volume of direct damage spells and efficient creatures, such as Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker. With a mix of burn spells like Chain Lightning and Lightning Bolt, along with creature buffs like Goblin Tomb Raider and Rally at the Hornburg, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the powerful Urza's lands to quickly ramp up mana and play large creatures such as Boulderbranch Golem, Bramble Wurm, and Generous Ent. In addition, it includes removal spells like Breath Weapon and Candy Trail to deal with threats. The deck also includes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Expedition Map to search for specific lands or creatures, while also having graveyard hate with cards like Bojuka Bog and Relic of Progenitus. The overall strategy is to establish board presence and outvalue the opponent with big creatures and control elements.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering spells and removing threats with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Skred. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation with spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find key cards. Murmuring Mystic and Lórien Revealed are used to generate tokens and put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to establish control of the board and finish the game with powerful threats like Azure Fleet Admiral and Crimson Fleet Commodore.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, aggressive white creatures while using enchantments and auras to boost their power and protect them. The deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Benevolent Blessing and Ethereal Armor to make the creatures harder to deal with. The inclusion of cards like Homestead Courage and Sentinel's Eyes also helps in keeping the creatures alive and resilient in combat.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive play with efficient creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk, supported by removal spells like Cast Down. The deck also utilizes bounce effects with cards like Refurbished Familiar to gain tempo advantage. The inclusion of cards like Lembas and Radiant Fountain helps to gain life and stabilize against aggressive strategies. Additionally, the deck features cards like Duress and Suffocating Fumes to disrupt opponent's plans. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the board through efficient plays.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using a combination of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Fireblast, along with creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Kessig Flamebreather. Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery provide additional ways to deal damage while also gaining advantage. Sneaky Snacker and Faithless Looting help in maintaining card advantage and filtering through the deck. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of damage before they can stabilize or mount a defense.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on early aggression and disruption with cheap creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, backed up by efficient counter spells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board with bounce spells like Sleep of the Dead and card draw/filtering cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. By maintaining a fast and consistent tempo, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on deploying Artifact creatures quickly with the help of various Artifact lands and mana ramp cards. It also includes removal spells and card draw to maintain control of the board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and burn spells, utilizing sacrifice effects to deal added damage. The deck combines aggressive creature plays with direct damage spells to quickly finish off the opponent before they can establish their own board presence.

This deck focuses on using artifacts and sacrificing them for value to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Thoughtcast to draw more resources and Galvanic Blast for direct damage, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence with cards like Myr Enforcer and Reckoner's Bargain. The inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb also allows for disruption against graveyard strategies, making it a versatile and adaptable deck in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on using low-cost spells to quickly build a board presence and protect it with counterspells. The deck aims to control the game tempo by constantly filling the graveyard with self-mill cards like Thought Scour and Mental Note while efficiently casting threats like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent. Lórien Revealed provides additional card advantage, while Sleep of the Dead can stall opponent's creatures to give the deck more time to establish dominance. Overall, the deck aims to win through aggressive plays and efficient spellcasting.
